Class SinglyLinkedList

java.lang.Object
  SinglyLinkedList

public class SinglyLinkedList
extends java.lang.Object

this is the class that is used to make a singly linked list with Node objects as the elements. There are methods to add, remove, modify, search, find the size, determine if it is empty, sort, merge sort set/get the head node (add first), set/get the tail node (add last), print items in ascending/descending order and a method to convert the linked list into a node array

Version:
1.00
Author:
Luke Geeson

Constructor Detail

SinglyLinkedList

public SinglyLinkedList()
this is the default constructor

SinglyLinkedList

public SinglyLinkedList(CNode firstNode,
                        CNode nextNode)
this constructor is used when a new linked list is created and you want to pass the first node of the list to it. If there is only one Node passed then pass null as the nextNode parameter

Parameters:
firstNode - the first node in the linked list, set as the head of the list
nextNode - the next node after the first, pass as null if there are no other nodes

                       CNode input)
adds a node to the end of the list

Parameters:
input - a node which will be set as the last item in the list

Returns:

printList

public void printList(CNode input)
prints the entire linked list in ascending order from the node input - will print from any node in the list to the end of the list but to print the whole list - pass the head node

Parameters:
input - the node from which you print

printReverseList

public void printReverseList(CNode input)
prints the linked list in descending order to the node which is input

Parameters:
input - prints all items from this point onward in descending order

toArray

public CNode[] toArray()
converts the Linked List to a data array so that the data contained in an array will itself be an array - no paramters

Returns:
dataArray an object array that will contain the data within each node of the linked list
